chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
W1: world
W2: PCM.sort (prodPCM (union_mapPCM Label protocol) (union_mapPCM hook_domain hook_type))
pf: injects W1 (W1 \+ W2) Unit

Goal:
valid (W1 \+ W2) -> inj_ext pf = W2

Premises:
union_mapPCM = fun (K : ordType) (V : Type) => PCM.Pack (union_mapPCMMix K V) : ordType -> Type -> pcm Arguments union_mapPCM _ _%type_scope
inj_ext : forall (U V : world) (K : hooks), Injection.injects U V K -> world
hook_domain = [ordType of nat * Label * (Label * nat)] : ordType
protocol = Protocols.protocol : Type
prodPCM = fun U V : pcm => PCM.Pack (prodPCMMixin U V) : pcm -> pcm -> pcm
Notation PCM T m := (PCM.pack m)
hook_type = heap -> heap -> seq nat -> nid -> Prop : Type
injects = Injection.injects : world -> world -> hooks -> Type
Label = [ordType of nat] : ordType
sort : forall T : Type, rel T -> seq T -> seq T
Notation valid := @PCM.valid
injExtR' : forall (W1 : prodPCM (union_mapPCM Label protocol) (union_mapPCM hook_domain hook_type)) (W2 : world) (K : hooks) (pf : injects W2 (W1 \+ W2) K), valid (W1 \+ W2) -> inj_ext pf \+ (Unit, K) = W1
projectSE : forall (W1 W2 : prodPCM (union_mapPCM Label protocol) (union_mapPCM hook_domain hook_type)) (s : state), s \In Coh (W1 \+ W2) -> s = projectS W1 s \+ projectS W2 s
injExtL' : forall (W1 W2 : world) (K : hooks) (pf : injects W1 (W1 \+ W2) K), valid (W1 \+ W2) -> inj_ext pf \+ (Unit, K) = W2
projectS_cohL : forall (W1 W2 : prodPCM (union_mapPCM Label protocol) (union_mapPCM hook_domain hook_type)) (s : state), s \In Coh (W1 \+ W2) -> hook_complete W1 -> projectS W1 s \In Coh W1
projectS_cohR : forall (W1 W2 : prodPCM (union_mapPCM Label protocol) (union_mapPCM hook_domain hook_type)) (s : state), s \In Coh (W1 \+ W2) -> hook_complete W2 -> projectS W2 s \In Coh W2
coh_split : forall (W1 W2 : prodPCM (union_mapPCM Label protocol) (union_mapPCM hook_domain hook_type)) (s : state), s \In Coh (W1 \+ W2) -> hook_complete W1 -> hook_complete W2 -> exists s1 s2 : state, [/\ s1 \In Coh W1, s2 \In Coh W2 & s = s1 \+ s2]
cohK : forall (U V : world) (K : hooks) (w : injects U V K), V = U \+ inj_ext w \+ (Unit, K)
joinxK : forall (U : cpcm) (x x1 x2 : U), valid (x \+ x1) -> x \+ x1 = x \+ x2 -> x1 = x2
sem_extend : forall (U V : world) (K : hooks), injects U V K -> forall (s1 s2 s : union_mapPCM Label dstatelet) (this : nid), s1 \+ s \In Coh V -> s2 \+ s \In Coh V -> network_step U this s1 s2 -> network_step V this (s1 \+ s) (s2 \+ s)
PCM.sort = fun t : pcm => let (sort, _) := t in sort : pcm -> Type PCM.sort is a coercion
Record injects (U V : world) (K : hooks) : Type := Inject { E : world; _ : hook_complete U /\ hook_complete E; _ : V = U \+ E \+ (Unit, K); _ : hooks_consistent (U \+ E) K; _ : forall s : state, Coh V s < -> (exists s1 s2 : union_mapPCM Label dstatelet, [/\ s = s1 \+ s2, Coh U s1 & Coh E s2]); _ : forall (s1 : union_mapPCM Label dstatelet) (s2 : state) (s : union_mapPCM Label dstatelet) (this : nid), s1 \+ s \In Coh V -> network_step U this s1 s2 ->...-> network_step U this s1 s2 /\ s1' = s2' \/ network_step E this s1' s2' /\ s1 = s2 } Arguments Injection.Inject [U V K E] _ _ _ (_ _ _)%function_scope
sem_split : forall (U V : world) (K : hooks) (w : injects U V K) (s1 : state) (s1' : union_mapPCM Label dstatelet) (s2 : state) (s2' : union_mapPCM Label dstatelet) (this : nid), s1 \In Coh U -> s2 \In Coh U -> network_step V this (s1 \+ s1') (s2 \+ s2') -> network_step U this s1 s2 /\ s1' = s2' \/ network_step (inj_ext w) this s1' s2' /\ s1 = s2
Injection.Inject : forall (U V : world) (K : hooks) (E : world), hook_complete U /\ hook_complete E -> V = U \+ E \+ (Unit, K) -> hooks_consistent (U \+ E) K -> (forall s : state, Coh V s <-> (exists s1 s2 : union_mapPCM Label dstatelet, [/\ s = s1 \+ s2, Coh U s1 & Coh E s2])) -> (forall (s1 : union_mapPCM Label dstatelet) (s2 : state) (s : union_mapPCM Label dstatelet) (this : nid), s1 \+ s \In Coh V -> network_step U this s1 s2 -> network_step V this (s1 \+ s) (s2 \+ s)) ->...-> Injection.injects U V K
Inject : forall (U V : world) (K : hooks) (E : world), hook_complete U /\ hook_complete E -> V = U \+ E \+ (Unit, K) -> hooks_consistent (U \+ E) K -> (forall s : state, Coh V s <-> (exists s1 s2 : union_mapPCM Label dstatelet, [/\ s = s1 \+ s2, Coh U s1 & Coh E s2])) -> (forall (s1 : union_mapPCM Label dstatelet) (s2 : state) (s : union_mapPCM Label dstatelet) (this : nid), s1 \+ s \In Coh V -> network_step U this s1 s2 -> network_step V this (s1 \+ s) (s2 \+ s)) ->...-> Injection.injects U V K
pcmPE : forall U V : pcm, (forall (x1 y1 : U) (x2 y2 : V), (x1, x2) \+ (y1, y2) = (x1 \+ y1, x2 \+ y2)) * (forall x : prodPCM U V, valid x = valid x.1 && valid x.2)
CohUn : forall (w1 w2 : world) (s1 s2 : state), Coh w1 s1 -> Coh w2 s2 -> valid (w1 \+ w2) -> Coh (w1 \+ w2) (s1 \+ s2)
validL : forall (U : pcm) (x y : U), valid (x \+ y) -> valid x
extends : forall (U V : world) (K : hooks), injects U V K -> union_mapPCM Label dstatelet -> union_mapPCM Label dstatelet -> Prop
cohE : forall (U V : world) (K : hooks) (w : injects U V K) (s : state), Coh V s < -> (exists s1 s2 : union_mapPCM Label dstatelet, [/\ s = s1 \+ s2, Coh U s1 & Coh (inj_ext w) s2])
Actions.can_send = fun (p : protocol) (this : nid) (l : Label) (s : state) => (l \in dom s) && (this \in nodes p (getStatelet s l)) : protocol -> nid -> Label -> state -> bool
findUnL : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type) (U : union_map_class K V) (k : K) (f1 f2 : U), valid (f1 \+ f2) -> find k (f1 \+ f2) = (if k \in dom f1 then find k f1 else find k f2)
joinA : forall (U : pcm) (x y z : U), x \+ (y \+ z) = x \+ y \+ z
hooks = union_map hook_domain hook_type : Type
joinC : forall (U : pcm) (x y : U), x \+ y = y \+ x
pcmPJ : forall (U V : pcm) (x1 y1 : U) (x2 y2 : V), (x1, x2) \+ (y1, y2) = (x1 \+ y1, x2 \+ y2)
prod_join0E : forall (U V : tpcm) (x y : prodPCM U V), x \+ y = Unit -> x = Unit /\ y = Unit
domUn : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type) (U : union_map_class K V) (f1 f2 : U), dom (f1 \+ f2) =i [pred x | valid (f1 \+ f2) & (x \in dom f1) || (x \in dom f2)]
plab = Protocols.plab : Protocols.protocol -> Label
EmptyProt = fun i : Label => Protocol i snd_uniq0 rcv_uniq0 : Label -> protocol
undef_join : forall (U : tpcm) (x : U), undef \+ x = undef

```coq
intros.
rewrite <- injExtR'.
apply coh_split in pf.
destruct pf as [s1 [s2 [H1 [H2 H3]]]].
apply projectSE in H3.
rewrite H3.
apply projectS_cohR in H2.
apply projectS_cohL in H1.
rewrite cohK.
reflexivity.
Qed.

original: intros. rewrite <- injExtR'. apply coh_split in pf. destruct pf as [s1 [s2 [H1 [H2 H3]]]]. apply projectSE in H3. rewrite H3. apply projectS_cohR in H2. apply projectS_cohL in H1. rewrite cohK. reflexivity.
